author: The Hawk Editor
content: India approves a Rs 10,372 crore AI mission for five years, announced by Union Minister Piyush Goyal. The fund will boost computing infrastructure and AI development, offering over 10,000 GPU supercomputing capacity to startups, academia, and the industry. A National Data Management Officer will enhance data quality for AI advancements.
title: Cabinet approves Rs 10,372 Crore AI mission for next 5 years

author: Editor
content: A new study by an international team of scientists presented a DNA nanomachine- a novel type of nano-engine made of DNA. It can make pulsing movements and is propelled by an intelligent mechanism. The idea is for the researchers to install it as a drive in intricate nanomachines after fitting it with a connection.
title: DNA nanomachine: A novel DNA nano-engine

author: Editor
content: A new study from Uppsala University aims to estimate the risk of depression associated with initiating oral contraceptives (OC) and the effect of OC use on the lifetime risk of depression.The study found that women who used combined contraceptive pills were at greater risk of developing depression.
title: Contraceptive pills increase womenâ€™s risk of depression

author: Raksha
content: A post by the storytelling platform Humans of Bombay uncovers the story of Vishwadeep, a man from Bangalore who's been diagnosed with Schizophrenia. Here, he reveals how he was unable to comprehend what was happening to him and Schizophrenia made him suspicious of everything and everyone around him. With time, he learnt to accept and understand his ailment with help.
title: Bangalore man diagnosed with Schizophrenia

author: Editor
content: Astronomers who have been examining old data on explosive explosions known as short gamma-ray bursts (GRBs) have found light patterns that suggest a superheavy neutron star existed briefly before collapsing into a black hole. The collision of two neutron stars probably created this fleeting, massive object.
title: Astronomers detected a superheavy neutron star

author: Editor
content: Now, a new study has denied the observations that cast doubt on the existence of dark matter. It offers detailed insights into understanding the nature of dark matter and its relationship with ordinary matter.The universe is in a constant state of change. This had led to the theory of the existence of dark matter, namely undetectable.
title: Dark matter exists, confirms study

author: Editor
content: In new research, a team of physicists has developed a method for predicting the composition of dark matter. It establishes new ways to find these signatures in more complex models, which experiments continue to search for. Scientists focused on big bang nucleosynthesis (BBN)- a process by which light forms of matter, such as helium, hydrogen, and lithium, are created.
title: Predicting cosmological signatures

author: Editor
content: A new study suggests that neutron star mergers are a treasure trove for new physics signals, with implications for determining the true nature of dark matter. Physicist Bhupal Dev in Arts & Sciences used observations from this neutron star merger- an event identified in astronomical circles as GW170817 - to derive new constraints on axion-like particles.
title: Neutron star mergers: New physics signals

author: Editor
content: The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) is vital for studying planet formation. JWST is improving our understanding of this process by examining the planets' birthplaces, which are the circumstellar disks that encircle young stars. A group of researchers led by the University of Arizona has imaged an ancient planet-forming disk actively distributing its gas content for the first time.
title: Neon sign identified by JWST gives clue to planet formation

author: Editor
content: A severe genetic disorder called spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) frequently results in the death of an infant. Professor Adrian Krainer of Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory (CSHL) found that RNA splicing adjustments could be used to cure sickle cell disease almost a decade ago. This discovery created new avenues for drug research and resulted in Spinraza.
title: Why are some RNA drugs more efficient than others?
